text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm ashwat Ram a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dallas today I'm going to show you how
to regain access to your AWS account if
you have lost access to your credentials
let's get
started there are a few common reasons
that might block you from logging into
your account you forgotten the password
you're using the wrong email
the administrator has changed the
authorization typically this error
happens when the administrator in your
organization updated the AWS identity
and access management
login let's see how to resolve each
scenario you know your email address but
you forgot or misplaced your
password this issue occurs when you
forget the password or misplace the
password for your root account but still
have access to to the email account in
this scenario we will reset the password
by following these
steps first go to aws.amazon.com and
choose the button in the upper right
corner if you see create an AWS account
then you get the option to sign in to an
existing AWS account after you choose
the
link then enter your root account email
address and then choose
next choose forget password on top of
the password box after the capture is
done AWS sends a link in an email to
that email address so you can reset the
password when you open this link in your
email the password reset page will open
in the browser you're then prompted to
enter a new password and to confirm it
after entering both choose reset
password note that your account might
have a slightly different process than
shown here but don't worry we'll still
send an automated email with the steps
to follow for resetting your
password now you can sign in with a new
password that you just
created you don't remember the email
address that you use to sign in to your
account if you don't know which email
address was used to sign up with AWS
check the emails that were sent to you
from noyen reply at
amazon.com these emails will be in
either your inbox folder or the spam
folder the email address with this email
received is the email address used for
signing up for
AWS if you still can't get to your AWS
account you can reach out to AWS support
for assistance return to the
aws.amazon.com web page and choose
contact us in upper right part of the
page scroll down to billing or Account
Support and choose get help recovering
your AWS account
password look for and choose I can't
sign in because my credentials don't
work in the article look for the line
that says I'm an AWS customer and I'm
looking for billing or Account Support
choose that hyperlink and then enter the
details to the prompts on the inquiry
type drop-down list choose unable to
sign in and someone from aw support will
reach out to
you please note AWS support can't
discuss any details about other AWS
accounts other than the account that
you're signed into also AWS support
can't change the credentials of an AWS
account for any
reason your IM credentials were
changed if your account is part of a
company or an organization you can use
AWS identity and access
management however if you try to use
your IM credentials to login and can't
it's possible that an authorized user or
an account administrator updated your
credentials without notifying
you contact your account administrator
so that they can update the credentials
and permissions associated with an IM
user they can also provide you with an
unique IM am signin URL for the account
some IM identities can update their own
passwords for more information check out
the AWS support documentation Linked In
the associated Knowledge Center
article so now you know how to regain
access to your AWS account if you have
lost access to your credentials thanks
for watching in Happy Cloud Computing
from all of us here at
[Music]
[Applause]
AWS
[Music]
